   15: %% @doc Third excercise: .
   16: %%    == Required Knowledge ==
   17: %%    <ul>
   18: %%    <li>Modules and functions</li>
   19: %%    <li>List functions</li>
   20: %%    <li>Basic Erlang Structures</li>
   21: %%    <li>Pattern Matching</li>
   22: %%    </ul>
   23: %%
   24: %%    == Problem Statement ==
   25: %%    Create a 4-in-a-row game manager
   26: %%    <dl>
   27: %%    <dt>start() -> board().</dt><dd>Returns an empty board</dd>
   28: %%    <dt>play(Col, Board) -> won | drawn | {next, board()}.</dt>
   29: %%      <dd>Accepts a play and returns:
   30: %%        <dl>
   31: %%          <dt>won</dt><dd>the player won</dd>
   32: %%          <dt>drawn</dt><dd>the game ended in a draw</dd>
   33: %%          <dt>next</dt><dd>the game should keep going</dd>
   34: %%        </dl>
   35: %%      </dd>
   36: %%    </dl>
   37: -module(fiar_core_SUITE).
   38: -author('elbrujohalcon@inaka.net').
   39: 
   40: -type config() :: [{atom(), term()}].
   41: -export([all/0]).
   42: -export([empty/1, invalid/1, drawn/1]).
   43: -export([wins_vertically/1, wins_horizontally/1, 
   44:          wins_right_diagonally/1, wins_left_diagonally/1]).
   45: 
   46: %% @private
   47: -spec all() -> [atom()].
   48: all() -> [Fun || {Fun, 1} <- module_info(exports), Fun =/= module_info].
   49: 
   50: %% @doc start returns an empty board
   51: -spec empty(config()) -> ok.
   52: empty(_Config) ->
   53:   Board = fiar_core:start(),
   54:   lists:foreach(
   55:     fun(Col) ->
   56:       {next, _} = fiar_core:play(Col, Board)
   57:     end,
   58:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7]),
   59:   ok.
   60: 
   61: %% @doc no row accepts more than 7 chips
   62: -spec invalid(config()) -> ok.
   63: invalid(_Config) ->
   64:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
   65:   BoardAfter7 = drop_chips(7, 1, EmptyBoard),
   66:   try fiar_core:play(1, BoardAfter7) of
   67:     Result ->
   68:       no_result = Result
   69:   catch
   70:     _:Ex ->
   71:       invalid_column = Ex
   72:   end,
   73:   ok.
   74: 
   75: %% @doc when the board is full, play should always return drawn
   76: -spec drawn(_Config) -> ok.
   77: drawn(_Config) ->
   78:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
   79:   FullBoard = almost_fill_board(EmptyBoard),
   80:   drawn = fiar_core:play(3, FullBoard),
   81:   ok.
   82: 
   83: %% @doc when the player puts 4 chips in a vertical row, wins
   84: -spec wins_vertically(config()) -> ok.
   85: wins_vertically(_Config) ->
   86:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
   87:   CheckMateBoard = drop_chips([1,2,1,2,1,2], EmptyBoard),
   88:   won = fiar_core:play(1, CheckMateBoard),
   89:   ok.
   90: 
   91: %% @doc when the player puts 4 chips in a horizontal row, wins
   92: -spec wins_horizontally(config()) -> ok.
   93: wins_horizontally(_Config) ->
   94:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
   95:   CheckMateBoard = drop_chips([2,5,3,6,4,7], EmptyBoard),
   96:   won = fiar_core:play(1, CheckMateBoard),
   97:   ok.
   98: 
   99: %% @doc when the player puts 4 chips in a diagonal row, wins
  100: -spec wins_right_diagonally(config()) -> ok.
  101: wins_right_diagonally(_Config) ->
  102:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
  103:   CheckMateBoard = drop_chips([4,4,4,4,6,3,3,3,2,2,7], EmptyBoard),
  104:   won = fiar_core:play(1, CheckMateBoard),
  105:   ok.
  106: 
  107: %% @doc when the player puts 4 chips in a diagonal row, wins
  108: -spec wins_left_diagonally(config()) -> ok.
  109: wins_left_diagonally(_Config) ->
  110:   EmptyBoard = fiar_core:start(),
  111:   CheckMateBoard = drop_chips([4,4,4,4,2,5,5,5,6,6,1], EmptyBoard),
  112:   won = fiar_core:play(7, CheckMateBoard),
  113:   ok.
  114: 
  115: %% @private
  116: %% @doc fills all columns in the board except #3
  117: almost_fill_board(Board) ->
  118:   WithColsExcept3 = lists:foldl(fun fill_column/2, Board, [1,4,2,5,6,7]),
  119:   drop_chips(6, 3, WithColsExcept3).
  120: 
  121: %% @private
  122: fill_column(Col, Board) -> drop_chips(7, Col, Board).
  123: 
  124: %% @private
  125: drop_chips(0, _Col, Board) -> Board;
  126: drop_chips(N, Col, Board) ->
  127:   {Col, Board, {next, NextBoard}} = {Col, Board, fiar_core:play(Col, Board)},
  128:   drop_chips(N-1, Col, NextBoard).
  129: 
  130: %% @private
  131: drop_chips([], Board) -> Board;
  132: drop_chips([Col|Rest], Board) ->
  133:   {Col, Board, {next, NextBoard}} = {Col, Board, fiar_core:play(Col, Board)},
  134:   drop_chips(Rest, NextBoard).
  135: 
  136: 
  137:
